Certainly a bittersweet reflection on the passing of time and the risk of forgetting who we are, the story well written, funny and at times even moving, The film features three unexpectedly excellent first ladies, perfectly at ease in their meeting with Aldo Giovanni and Giacomo as well as the return of their historic director, who still knows how to make the most of their potential.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2309,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-01-30","keywords":"friend","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3128737305","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5Y2E2MWUtMTdkYS00NjI3LTg0NzQtNTZmZmQwMjA0MDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5Y2E2MWUtMTdkYS00NjI3LTg0NzQtNTZmZmQwMjA0MDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017623/","name":"Aldo Baglio","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320495/","name":"Giovanni Storti","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316034/","name":"Giacomo Poretti"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893111/","name":"Massimo Venier"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043281/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117688/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254125/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3291357/","name":"Davide Lantieri","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1614496/","name":"Michele Pellegrini","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893111/","name":"Massimo Venier"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Walk in the Clouds
Spacer w chmurach
A Walk in the Clouds
programme.desc: A Walk in the Clouds: Directed by Alfonso Arau. With Keanu Reeves, Aitana Sánchez-Gijón, Anthony Quinn, Giancarlo Giannini. A married soldier returning from World War II poses as a pregnant woman's husband to save her from her father's anger and honor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0114887/","name":"A Walk in the Clouds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQ5NzI2NWQtODVjZi00NDk1LTg1NmMtZDVlNWMwODZmNGI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzOTY1NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A married soldier returning from World War II poses as a pregnant woman's husband to save her from her father's anger and honor.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0114887/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviebuff"},"dateCreated":"2001-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A charming romance for a more cynical time","reviewBody":"You often hear people lament:"they don't make them like they used to". This film is one of those magical examples where they really do. Alfonso Arau has given us one of the most poignant, old-fashioned romance films in many a year. Set in the Napa Valley shortly after the end of World War II, Keanu Reeves and Aitana Sanchez-Gijon play two people searching for their futures. Reeves as an ex-GI in a pointless job with a wife he hardly knows and Sanchez-Gijon as a pregnant and abandoned woman afraid to face the shame she will bring to her family. They agree to pose as a married couple in order for her to save face and placate the anticipated anger of her stern father. What follows is a lovingly realized story of family, love and understanding played out against the beauty of the northern California wine country. The vineyard owned by Sanchez-Gijon's family is pure fantasy created by some wonderful visual effects but it provides the perfect setting for the film. There are moments in this film of sensual beauty every bit as breathtaking as the vineyard itself. One of the great joys of this film is the performance of Anthony Quinn as Don Pedro, Sanchez-Gijon's grandfather. He steals every scene he's in. His performance is funny and charming and his character always has a knowing twinkle in his eye. A pure delight to watch. For those with unjaded hearts, settle down with the one you love and share a glass of wine as you watch this film and relish it's pure heart and the exquisite joy of it's touching romance."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-08-11","keywords":"falling in love,1940s,aftermath of world war ii,war aftermath,helping someone","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Walk In The Clouds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3904110873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000206/","name":"Keanu Reeves"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0845209/","name":"Aitana Sánchez-Gijón"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000063/","name":"Anthony Quinn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000778/","name":"Alfonso Arau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042359/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436543/","name":"Robert Mark Kamen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588903/","name":"Mark Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919386/","name":"Harvey Weitzman"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

This film is one of those magical examples where they really do. Alfonso Arau has given us one of the most poignant, old-fashioned romance films in many a year. Set in the Napa Valley shortly after the end of World War II, Keanu Reeves and Aitana Sanchez-Gijon play two people searching for their futures. Reeves as an ex-GI in a pointless job with a wife he hardly knows and Sanchez-Gijon as a pregnant and abandoned woman afraid to face the shame she will bring to her family. One of the great joys of this film is the performance of Anthony Quinn as Don Pedro, Sanchez-Gijon's grandfather. He steals every scene he's in. His performance is funny and charming and his character always has a knowing twinkle in his eye. A pure delight to watch. For those with unjaded hearts, settle down with the one you love and share a glass of wine as you watch this film and relish it's pure heart and the exquisite joy of it's touching romance.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-08-11","keywords":"falling in love,1940s,aftermath of world war ii,war aftermath,helping someone","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Walk In The Clouds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3904110873","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000206/","name":"Keanu Reeves","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0845209/","name":"Aitana Sánchez-Gijón","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000063/","name":"Anthony Quinn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000778/","name":"Alfonso Arau"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042359/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436543/","name":"Robert Mark Kamen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588903/","name":"Mark Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919386/","name":"Harvey Weitzman"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Tax Collector
Windykator
The Tax Collector
programme.desc:
The Tax Collector: Directed by David Ayer. With Bobby Soto, Cinthya Carmona, Shia LaBeouf, Jose Conejo Martin. A "tax collector" working for a local crime lord finds his family's safety compromised when the rival of his boss shows up in L.A. and upends the business." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8461224/","name":"The Tax Collector","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmFmZTdhYmItNjIyZS00ZjVlLWFjZjgtMjMyMDA5ZmVjNzE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A "tax collector" working for a local crime lord finds his family's safety compromised when the rival of his boss shows up in L.A. and upends the business.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8461224/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"The biggest disappointing let-down of wasted opportunity","reviewBody":"This could've easily been one of the best crime films in a long time - up there with Sicario, if only with a little more effort. But experienced writer and director David Ayer failed miserably with his screenplay on what could've and should've been. I've seen amateur writers have tighter, more fluid, and logical screenplays. And it's a shame, because it really didn't need that much effort to fix. A few adjustments here and there, and/or better editing. Everything else was perfection.

Casting and performances - especially LaBeouf, were so convincing, you felt it. Cinematography and score were flawless. Even Ayer's directing was decent, although the "good" scenes needed more/better/longer takes. But Geoffrey O'Brien's editing was horrible, and with the convoluted choppy screenplay, is what failed this film.

I can't stand long films, especially when the story drags out, but I was left begging this screenplay had more much needed content and clarity in it, without taking out any of the current scenes. Another 20 mins added to the current 95 min runtime would have complimented and completed this little gem. Such a waste of everything else that was perfect.

Nevertheless, I am still shocked by the low ratings and bad reviews. I can only subtract 2 stars out of 10 for the horrible editing and lacking screenplay, because this could've easily been a perfect 10/10. So sadly, best it deserves is 8/10, because even with it's flaws, it's still one of the better films I've seen in a long time."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-07","keywords":"street,tattoo,gun,tax,tax collector","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1931263513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIwZjE1YmEtNGM1Zi00MDc0LWEwOTUtNzUyYmYyMmI2ZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIwZjE1YmEtNGM1Zi00MDc0LWEwOTUtNzUyYmYyMmI2ZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"David (Bobby Soto) and Creeper (Shia LaBeouf), are "tax collectors" for the crime lord Wizard, collecting his cut from the profits of local gangs' illicit dealings. But when Wizard's old rival returns to Los Angeles from Mexico, the business is upended, and David finds himself desperate to protect what matters more to him than anything else: his family."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2925352/","name":"Bobby Soto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4712342/","name":"Cinthya Carmona"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0479471/","name":"Shia LaBeouf"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043742/","name":"David Ayer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0680454/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0285648/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0725662/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043742/","name":"David Ayer"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Szczęście
programme.desc: Joanna, Tadeusz, Mariusz i Julia marzą o spokoju, sukcesie i miłości. Los okazuje się jednak przewrotny, o czym się przekonają w pewne zimowe popołudnie.

programme.title: Kochankowie roku tygrysa
Kochankowie roku tygrysa
programme.desc:
Kochankowie roku tygrysa: Directed by Jacek Bromski. With Michal Zebrowski, Li Min, Sun Ji Feng, Wu Fen Xia. The year is 1913. Two Poles escape exile and cross the Siberian taiga to China. Crossing the Amur River ends tragically for one of them. The surviving man, unconscious, is found by an old Chinese hunter who takes him to his mountain shack. The hunter has a beautiful, sixteen year old daughter. Not to tempt fortune, the parents make the girl cut her hair and dress like a boy. But is it enough to prevent feelings from arising between the two?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0484051/","name":"Kochankowie roku tygrysa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmY3M2Q2MjEtMTk2Ny00OWIyLThjZDMtZjUyZWY0ZjQwNjkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The year is 1913. Two Poles escape exile and cross the Siberian taiga to China. Crossing the Amur River ends tragically for one of them. The surviving man, unconscious, is found by an old Chinese hunter who takes him to his mountain ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0484051/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"willd-6"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unrefined yet poignant...","reviewBody":"I really didn't have a good idea what this film was about before I viewed it. A Polish-directed/written film set in China with basically an entirely Chinese cast? A bit foreign for me (being from the US), to say the least.

Starting out with the main character Wolski escaping from Russian Siberia into China, you watch as he is taken in by a poor Chinese family consisting of Guo, his wife, and their daughter Song. So far, so good.

However, one night Song gets up from the dinner table and takes some food to Wolski. As soon as she sits down on his bed Guo comes in and knocks the food right out of her hand. From this moment on, Song is never the same, and you will see why.

My main complaint of this movie is that it is slow and lacks focus/direction in the early (after the first 9min) to middle parts. It is a bit slow but luckily it picks up in the last third.

One thing this movie does well is subtlety. Maybe this is a trait of foreign films in general? I am not sure because I haven't seen enough. My recommendation is if you're a fan of or interested in foreign films and enjoy short but sincere romances, then give this film a shot.

Otherwise, it might not be for you. I think I got something out of it, and for an otherwise stoic personality like myself, it definitely touched me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":120,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"genre":["Adventure","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-09-01","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0954076/","name":"Michal Zebrowski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1546399/","name":"Li Min"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2066134/","name":"Sun Ji Feng"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111369/","name":"Jacek Bromski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080717/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093398/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111369/","name":"Jacek Bromski"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

The surviving man, unconscious, is found by an old Chinese hunter who takes him to his mountain ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0484051/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"willd-6","dateCreated":"2006-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unrefined yet poignant...","reviewBody":"I really didn't have a good idea what this film was about before I viewed it. A Polish-directed/written film set in China with basically an entirely Chinese cast? A bit foreign for me (being from the US), to say the least.

Starting out with the main character Wolski escaping from Russian Siberia into China, you watch as he is taken in by a poor Chinese family consisting of Guo, his wife, and their daughter Song. So far, so good.

However, one night Song gets up from the dinner table and takes some food to Wolski. As soon as she sits down on his bed Guo comes in and knocks the food right out of her hand. From this moment on, Song is never the same, and you will see why.

My main complaint of this movie is that it is slow and lacks focus/direction in the early (after the first 9min) to middle parts. It is a bit slow but luckily it picks up in the last third.

One thing this movie does well is subtlety. Maybe this is a trait of foreign films in general? I am not sure because I haven't seen enough. My recommendation is if you're a fan of or interested in foreign films and enjoy short but sincere romances, then give this film a shot.

Otherwise, it might not be for you. programme.title: A Walk in the Clouds
Spacer w chmurach
A Walk in the Clouds
programme.desc: A Walk in the Clouds: Directed by Alfonso Arau. With Keanu Reeves, Aitana Sánchez-Gijón, Anthony Quinn, Giancarlo Giannini. A married soldier returning from World War II poses as a pregnant woman's husband to save her from her father's anger and honor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0114887/","name":"A Walk in the Clouds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQ5NzI2NWQtODVjZi00NDk1LTg1NmMtZDVlNWMwODZmNGI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzOTY1NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A married soldier returning from World War II poses as a pregnant woman's husband to save her from her father's anger and honor.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0114887/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviebuff"},"dateCreated":"2001-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A charming romance for a more cynical time","reviewBody":"You often hear people lament:"they don't make them like they used to". This film is one of those magical examples where they really do. Alfonso Arau has given us one of the most poignant, old-fashioned romance films in many a year. Set in the Napa Valley shortly after the end of World War II, Keanu Reeves and Aitana Sanchez-Gijon play two people searching for their futures. Reeves as an ex-GI in a pointless job with a wife he hardly knows and Sanchez-Gijon as a pregnant and abandoned woman afraid to face the shame she will bring to her family. They agree to pose as a married couple in order for her to save face and placate the anticipated anger of her stern father. What follows is a lovingly realized story of family, love and understanding played out against the beauty of the northern California wine country. The vineyard owned by Sanchez-Gijon's family is pure fantasy created by some wonderful visual effects but it provides the perfect setting for the film. There are moments in this film of sensual beauty every bit as breathtaking as the vineyard itself. One of the great joys of this film is the performance of Anthony Quinn as Don Pedro, Sanchez-Gijon's grandfather. He steals every scene he's in. His performance is funny and charming and his character always has a knowing twinkle in his eye. A pure delight to watch. For those with unjaded hearts, settle down with the one you love and share a glass of wine as you watch this film and relish it's pure heart and the exquisite joy of it's touching romance."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-08-11","keywords":"falling in love,1940s,aftermath of world war ii,war aftermath,helping someone","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Walk In The Clouds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3904110873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FlOTU3OGUtZjZkZC00ZjRjLTljMWMtMTVkNDg2MmVlMDQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000206/","name":"Keanu Reeves"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0845209/","name":"Aitana Sánchez-Gijón"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000063/","name":"Anthony Quinn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000778/","name":"Alfonso Arau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042359/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436543/","name":"Robert Mark Kamen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588903/","name":"Mark Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919386/","name":"Harvey Weitzman"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

Jurek Kiler (see the prequel to this movie, "Kiler") has become a VIP - sponsoring the Polish government, playing tennis with the President, and stuff. He must oversee a transfer of a substantial amount of gold. However, in his past activities, he has made enemies. Mighty ones. programme.title: 10 giorni senza mamma
Sami bez mamy
10 giorni senza mamma
programme.desc: 10 giorni senza mamma: Directed by Alessandro Genovesi. With Fabio De Luigi, Valentina Lodovini, Angelica Elli, Bianca Usai. What happens if an always-present mother decides to leave for 10 days, leaving the three children with a father who was practically absent until then?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8660788/","name":"10 giorni senza mamma","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUzMzhkMGYtOTU1Ni00Y2UzLWJkOTktMjg3ZWFjM2ExOTM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQ4MDQ4ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"What happens if an always-present mother decides to leave for 10 days, leaving the three children with a father who was practically absent until then?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8660788/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"avillamaina"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Usual stereotypes, moderate humour","reviewBody":"This movie builds on the nowadays common stereotypes where mothers don't have a job in spite of being truly brilliant, being able to steer through a myriad of daily chores and activities with kids while working fathers are completely useless, showing that they would never cope with switching roles, not even for 10 days. programme.title: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto
Polański, Horowitz. Hometown
programme.desc: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto: Directed by Mateusz Kudla, Anna Kokoszka-Romer. With Roman Polanski, Ryszard Horowitz, Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska, Stanislaw Buchala. Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8546414/","name":"Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NmQ3NmEtY2NkOC00ZmI2LTg3YmUtNTc2MGEwNWQ2OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk5MjEzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8546414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"belenus-133-722656"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving true strory.","reviewBody":"This is a beautiful documentary. It takes you right into the heart of the darkest period in the 20th century, right into the heart of a Holocaust - Krakow in Poland, where the famous Plaszow ghetto was located and where the trains were loaded for Auschwitz. It's also a very intimate and moving portrait of a true friendship between two great artists. We get to see incredible suffering but also have a chance to witness a fantastic sense of humour, which obviously is the best way to deal with such sad memories. We can also now understand why Polanski refused to film "The Shindler's List" and instead filmed "The Pianist". We should be very grateful to film authors. PS - People who give this film a low rating obviously have not seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-08-20","keywords":"childhood","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1058543/","name":"Ryszard Horowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7061785/","name":"Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0701909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Airport
Port lotniczy
Airport
programme.desc:
Airport: Directed by George Seaton, Henry Hathaway. With Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, Jean Seberg, Jacqueline Bisset. A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0065377/","name":"Airport","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk5NWJkYjItMjA2MC00NThiLWE4NTctOTFlYjcwOTA1YTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0065377/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AaronCapenBanner"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Disaster Drama.","reviewBody":"George Seaton directed this massive box-office hit about an busy airport(of course!) threatened not only by a blizzard, but a bomber on one of its planes. All-star cast includes Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, Jacqueline Bissit, Van Heflin, Maureen Stapleton, and George Kennedy as Joe Patroni, a role he would reprise in the three sequels.

Though long, contrived, and potentially silly, this film still managed to be entertaining in spite of the melodrama, thanks to the good cast of actors who still give it their all(and a wonderful, Academy Award winning performance by Helen Hayes as a chronic "stowaway".)

Though star Burt Lancaster was embarrassed by its success, and despite later spoofing, this holds up as fine escapist fare.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18505,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1970-03-05","keywords":"boeing 707,cockpit,air crew,airport,bomb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1608826905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhYWQwZTItZjc1NS00NjUzLThhYmMtZDU4NzMxNThlYjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhYWQwZTItZjc1NS00NjUzLThhYmMtZDU4NzMxNThlYjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000044/","name":"Burt Lancaster"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001509/","name":"Dean Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001421/","name":"George Kennedy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780833/","name":"George Seaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0368871/","name":"Henry Hathaway"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119020/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0354150/","name":"Arthur Hailey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780833/","name":"George Seaton"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: All My Life
All My Life
programme.desc: All My Life: Directed by Marc Meyers. With Jessica Rothe, Harry Shum Jr., Marielle Scott, Chrissie Fit. A couple's wedding plans are thrown off course when the groom is diagnosed with liver cancer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8305852/","name":"All My Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGJiMzBlY2ItZTRjNS00OWFiLWI4YmUtZjVlMmY4OWFhMTIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple's wedding plans are thrown off course when the groom is diagnosed with liver cancer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8305852/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LiveLoveLead"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Based on a true story, makes it more endearing!","reviewBody":"Based on a true story (they show the actual couple at the end), this movie takes you on a roller coaster ride of emotions, happy tears and smiles for the sweet romantic parts and sad tears for the heartbreaking parts. It's not the most original or best film out there, but it was a romantic and beautiful story that was very delightful to watch. The characters were charming, the acting was decent, the music was fun, and the message was meaningful. It might be a little to cute/sappy/chick flick for some, but it is an enjoyable and touching film IMHO! Aug2021.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3112,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"wedding,three word title,terminal illness,cancer,liver cancer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3348087065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY5MmI2ODItMGNhZS00MjQzLTgwYTEtMGViNjZkMDA4NzA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY5MmI2ODItMGNhZS00MjQzLTgwYTEtMGViNjZkMDA4NzA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the powerful true love story that inspired an entire nation, All My Life follows the journey of an engaged couple who make the difficult decision to accelerate their wedding in the wake of a devastating discovery."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557329/","name":"Jessica Rothe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1484270/","name":"Harry Shum Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2900746/","name":"Marielle Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1836315/","name":"Marc Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163543/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0739708/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1565798/","name":"Todd Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Radioactive
Skłodowska
Radioactive
programme.desc:
Radioactive: Directed by Marjane Satrapi. With Rosamund Pike, Yvette Feuer, Mirjam Novak, Ralph Berkin. The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6017756/","name":"Radioactive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkNzY3MmUtYjJlNC00NTM0LWFiNmYtZDA4NzBiMmU1MzI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE0OTU5Nzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The incredible true story of Marie Sklodowska-Curie and her Nobel Prize-winning work that changed the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6017756/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Snootz"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Poorly written, badly directed and underwhelming","reviewBody":"The most accurate thing I can say about this movie is that I watched it... then went searching for the real story. This excessive dramatization I am sure does little to present the true story.

Unlike many here I did not mind the reference to Hiroshima and Chernobyl. Although these happened long after Curie died and had no effect on her career, they were reminders of an important fact: science can be used in a beneficial manner, or in a questionable and disastrous manner. These things had nothing to do with Curie herself, but were cautionary references that I found pertinent to the concept that discovery always bears consequence.

As for Curie herself, at the end of this flick I felt I knew no more about her than when I started watching. The story dramatizes her personal life and excessively focuses on personal relationships while leaving out far too much of her science and actual career accomplishments. That is certainly no credit to the production and earns it a "mediocre" 5 stars.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15737,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-06-15","keywords":"scientist,physicist,science,physics,chemistry","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1577631257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxMzMxYWQtZjM5Mi00ZGYzLTgyNzUtZWFjNDQ5NTliYjBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"A story of the scientific and romantic passions of Marie Sklodowska-Curie (Polish scientist) and Pierre Curie, and the reverberation of their discoveries throughout the 20th century."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0683253/","name":"Rosamund Pike"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275431/","name":"Yvette Feuer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597296/","name":"Mirjam Novak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2277869/","name":"Marjane Satrapi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113666/","name":"Jack Thorne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9706688/","name":"Lauren Redniss"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mordene i Kongo
Kongo
Mordene i Kongo
programme.desc:
Mordene i Kongo: Directed by Marius Holst. With Aksel Hennie, Tobias Santelmann, Ine F. Jansen, Dennis Storhøi. In the spring of 2009 two Norwegian adventurers, Joshua French and Tjostolv Moland, are accused of killing their hired chauffeur just before crossing into the eastern Congo. The following manhunt starts a political and diplomatic headache." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7356382/","name":"Mordene i Kongo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmE3ZDcyYzQtNDVlZS00MWQzLThkMzMtYzM5OWJmMjFkYzgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the spring of 2009 two Norwegian adventurers, Joshua French and Tjostolv Moland, are accused of killing their hired chauffeur just before crossing into the eastern Congo. The following manhunt starts a political and diplomatic hea","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7356382/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ops-52535"},"dateCreated":"2019-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"a very special film","reviewBody":"This film is not a documentary, its not a biographical flick either, more a drama of true happenings based on books,interviews,family,friend,and statements given by moland and french, about what happened one fateful night in the jungle of civil war ridden democratic republic of congo in 2009. when launched in norwegian cinemas it recieved mixed to negative reviews by media and made great debate in norwegian public and social media. the main issue were that the filmmakers tried to accentuate mr moland and mr french as heroes.

what my personal view on the story is based on are the plentyful coverage made by norwegian broadcasters from the start til mr french got home to norway in 2017 as a relative free man. i shall also make a note that ive heard stories from personal friends with good connections both to the norwegian military and deep bonds to central african affairs that both mr french and mr moland were adrenalin seekers, well known mercinaries, very well seasoned within weapon use and warfare, and a pretty good example of ''brothers in arms''. if that is correct or not only history will tell, what i felt when the trials rolled on slow congolese pace were pittyness for them and especially their parents and families. so whats wrong or whats right,who knows, only joshua can tell because he is the only survivor of this drama. so i hope the congolese government uses the ransom money paid by the norwegian state to plant some ''joshua trees'' to make the blind man see and eventually climb down and give the victims, including mr moland some piece.

so This is a very inconclusive film when considering the guilt of crimes,that tjostolv moland and joshua french were accused for by congolese criminal courts.

but as a film it delivers brilliant acting, most of all by aksel hennie as mr french, and fulfilled by his coactor Tobias Santelmann as mr moland. the filmographic presentation are very good, the locations and production design are very truthfull and close up to the real world. the sound and some of the shooting scene made me jump on the sofa more than once. so wether you have heard about the case of them two norwegian mercenaries or not and want to enjoy a really well made film on low budget then watch this film by the director Marius Holst and his crew and 30-35 producers, because it makes tension into a new definition. very good and recommended.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-10-26","keywords":"manhunt,africa,congo,based on real people,based on real person","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0377336/","name":"Aksel Hennie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4083737/","name":"Tobias Santelmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1262180/","name":"Ine F. Jansen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0392319/","name":"Marius Holst"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0207853/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0662577/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136790/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7251124/","name":"Stephen Uhlander"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Anonymous
Anonimus
Anonymous
programme.desc:
Anonymous: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Rhys Ifans, Vanessa Redgrave, Sebastian Armesto, Rafe Spall. The theory that it was in fact Edward De Vere, Earl of Oxford, who penned Shakespeare's plays. Set against the backdrop of the succession of Queen Elizabeth I and the Essex rebellion against her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1521197/","name":"Anonymous","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxOTA5MTMxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDI4MzU0NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The theory that it was in fact Edward De Vere, Earl of Oxford, who penned Shakespeare's plays. Set against the backdrop of the succession of Queen Elizabeth I and the Essex rebellion against her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1521197/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviewizguy"},"dateCreated":"2011-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Was Shakespeare a Fraud?","reviewBody":"Set in the political snake-pit of Elizabethan England, Anonymous speculates on an issue that has for centuries intrigued academics and brilliant minds such as Mark Twain, Charles Dickens, and Sigmund Freud, namely: who actually created the body of work credited to William Shakespeare? Experts have debated, books have been written, and scholars have devoted their lives to protecting or debunking theories surrounding the authorship of the most renowned works in English literature. Anonymous poses one possible answer, focusing on a time when scandalous political intrigue, illicit romances in the Royal Court, and the schemes of greedy nobles lusting for the power of the throne were brought to light in the most unlikely of places: the London stage. -- (C) Sony Pictures

As an average movie-goer, I had no idea that Shakespeare's authorship was ever questioned. I didn't know there were theories that existed that other people might have been the true author of the plays, one of which the film focuses on is Oxford. But as far as what ANONYMOUS achieves, it certainly opened my mind as an individual that there is a possibility that another person might have been the true writer of the plays. I mean, why not? It makes the whole thing pertaining to Shakespeare's plays much more interesting. At the most basic level, ANONYMOUS does one thing right: It's damn interesting and entertaining.

Even as a person who never liked Shakespeare's plays (especially the dreaded ROMEO AND JULIET), the film manages to be involving. I was compelled throughout the film, and what makes it work are the actors. Most of them are on the top of their game, including Rhys Ifans who is unrecognizable as Oxford compared to his role in HARRY POTTER 7 PT.1. Even his stares are intense. Rafe Spall as William Shakespeare seems to have a field day with his role, portraying him as an attention-seeking, moneygrubbing actor. I'd also like to point out that Sebastian Armesto, playing Ben Jonson, seems to have an unexpected greater amount of sreentime than anyone else in the film, and he does well in his role as the aspiring writer who plays as a messenger between Oxford and Shakespeare.

Another interesting thing to point out is that the film really doesn't focus on the whole authorship debate a lot. We see that Oxford is the writer giving the scripts to Ben, but other than that, the film pretty much brushes it off to the side and, instead, focuses more on the relationship between Oxford and Queen Elizabeth I as well as the Essex Rebellion. As you can tell, the cast is pretty huge, and I have to admit the first 20 minutes of the film is pretty confusing. We're introduced to a world with many characters and time periods jumping all over the place, but it gets easier to grasp once you get to know the characters.

Overall, ANONYMOUS is an interesting and entertaining film that will get people talking about who the real author of the plays are. The least anyone would get out of it is two hours of a fun "what if?" scenario. The performances by the cast is what really makes the film, though. If it wasn't for the cast, the film wouldn't have worked. Additionally, haters of director Roland Emmerich might find themselves pleased that ANONYMOUS is a character-driven film that doesn't rely on things being destroyed every five minutes. I'd like to see him make more films like this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40234,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-10-28","keywords":"conspiracy theory,william shakespeare character,elizabeth i character,historical fiction,earl of oxford","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"10 Reasons Why Shakespeare Is a Fraud","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1157013017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NjgyNTU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MjMyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NjgyNTU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MjMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Director Roland Emmerich gives 10 reasons why he believes Shakespeare was a fraud."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0406975/","name":"Rhys Ifans"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000603/","name":"Vanessa Redgrave"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000667/","name":"David Thewlis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650089/","name":"John Orloff"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

Anonymous poses one possible answer, focusing on a time when scandalous political intrigue, illicit romances in the Royal Court, and the schemes of greedy nobles lusting for the power of the throne were brought to light in the most unlikely of places: the London stage. -- (C) Sony Pictures

As an average movie-goer, I had no idea that Shakespeare's authorship was ever questioned. I didn't know there were theories that existed that other people might have been the true author of the plays, one of which the film focuses on is Oxford. Additionally, haters of director Roland Emmerich might find themselves pleased that ANONYMOUS is a character-driven film that doesn't rely on things being destroyed every five minutes. programme.title: Anonymous
Anonimus
Anonymous
programme.desc:
Anonymous: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Rhys Ifans, Vanessa Redgrave, Sebastian Armesto, Rafe Spall. The theory that it was in fact Edward De Vere, Earl of Oxford, who penned Shakespeare's plays. Set against the backdrop of the succession of Queen Elizabeth I and the Essex rebellion against her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1521197/","name":"Anonymous","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxOTA5MTMxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDI4MzU0NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The theory that it was in fact Edward De Vere, Earl of Oxford, who penned Shakespeare's plays. Set against the backdrop of the succession of Queen Elizabeth I and the Essex rebellion against her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1521197/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviewizguy"},"dateCreated":"2011-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Was Shakespeare a Fraud?","reviewBody":"Set in the political snake-pit of Elizabethan England, Anonymous speculates on an issue that has for centuries intrigued academics and brilliant minds such as Mark Twain, Charles Dickens, and Sigmund Freud, namely: who actually created the body of work credited to William Shakespeare? Experts have debated, books have been written, and scholars have devoted their lives to protecting or debunking theories surrounding the authorship of the most renowned works in English literature. Anonymous poses one possible answer, focusing on a time when scandalous political intrigue, illicit romances in the Royal Court, and the schemes of greedy nobles lusting for the power of the throne were brought to light in the most unlikely of places: the London stage. -- (C) Sony Pictures

As an average movie-goer, I had no idea that Shakespeare's authorship was ever questioned. I didn't know there were theories that existed that other people might have been the true author of the plays, one of which the film focuses on is Oxford. But as far as what ANONYMOUS achieves, it certainly opened my mind as an individual that there is a possibility that another person might have been the true writer of the plays. I mean, why not? It makes the whole thing pertaining to Shakespeare's plays much more interesting. At the most basic level, ANONYMOUS does one thing right: It's damn interesting and entertaining.

Even as a person who never liked Shakespeare's plays (especially the dreaded ROMEO AND JULIET), the film manages to be involving. I was compelled throughout the film, and what makes it work are the actors. Most of them are on the top of their game, including Rhys Ifans who is unrecognizable as Oxford compared to his role in HARRY POTTER 7 PT.1. Even his stares are intense. Rafe Spall as William Shakespeare seems to have a field day with his role, portraying him as an attention-seeking, moneygrubbing actor. I'd also like to point out that Sebastian Armesto, playing Ben Jonson, seems to have an unexpected greater amount of sreentime than anyone else in the film, and he does well in his role as the aspiring writer who plays as a messenger between Oxford and Shakespeare.

Another interesting thing to point out is that the film really doesn't focus on the whole authorship debate a lot. We see that Oxford is the writer giving the scripts to Ben, but other than that, the film pretty much brushes it off to the side and, instead, focuses more on the relationship between Oxford and Queen Elizabeth I as well as the Essex Rebellion. As you can tell, the cast is pretty huge, and I have to admit the first 20 minutes of the film is pretty confusing. We're introduced to a world with many characters and time periods jumping all over the place, but it gets easier to grasp once you get to know the characters.

Overall, ANONYMOUS is an interesting and entertaining film that will get people talking about who the real author of the plays are. The least anyone would get out of it is two hours of a fun "what if?" scenario. The performances by the cast is what really makes the film, though. If it wasn't for the cast, the film wouldn't have worked. Additionally, haters of director Roland Emmerich might find themselves pleased that ANONYMOUS is a character-driven film that doesn't rely on things being destroyed every five minutes. I'd like to see him make more films like this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40234,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-10-28","keywords":"conspiracy theory,william shakespeare character,elizabeth i character,historical fiction,earl of oxford","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"10 Reasons Why Shakespeare Is a Fraud","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1157013017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NjgyNTU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MjMyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NjgyNTU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MjMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Director Roland Emmerich gives 10 reasons why he believes Shakespeare was a fraud."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0406975/","name":"Rhys Ifans"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000603/","name":"Vanessa Redgrave"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000667/","name":"David Thewlis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650089/","name":"John Orloff"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Words on Bathroom Walls
Przewrotny umysł
Words on Bathroom Walls
programme.desc:
Words on Bathroom Walls: Directed by Thor Freudenthal. With Charlie Plummer, Andy Garcia, Taylor Russell, AnnaSophia Robb. Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his condition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8045906/","name":"Words on Bathroom Walls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmNTNlZDEtM2JjNy00MmNmLTgzNWItN2VlZGNlNjM1YjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTExMDk0NzQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his cond","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8045906/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Teenager learns to cope with his schizophrenia.","reviewBody":"Curious title, it refers to both real words written on school bathroom walls, and even more the imaginary words he sees when he had bouts with his mental illness.

Based on the cast I figured this would be another mainly generic teenage rom-com. But it is just the opposite. While Adam (Charlie Plummer) starts a relationship with the bright girl in class after he asks her to tutor him, the story is overwhelmingly about Adam, and his family, and ultimately his school coming to grips with his schizophrenia.

Plummer is required to really stretch his acting chops and he does it well. The middle third of the movie is hard to watch at times but fortunately the final third starts to bring some healing.

Good movie, my wife and I watched it at home on DVD from our public library."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7600,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-08-21","keywords":"based on young adult novel,schizophrenia,hallucination,hospital,restraint","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3428105753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager coping with paranoid schizophrenia hopes his new experimental drug treatment will help him navigate high school and the outside world."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4055138/","name":"Charlie Plummer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5347988/","name":"Taylor Russell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294457/","name":"Thor Freudenthal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0811450/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4550950/","name":"Nick Naveda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9649443/","name":"Julia Walton"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his condition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8045906/","name":"Words on Bathroom Walls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmNTNlZDEtM2JjNy00MmNmLTgzNWItN2VlZGNlNjM1YjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTExMDk0NzQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Diagnosed with a mental illness halfway through his senior year of high school, a witty, introspective teen struggles to keep it a secret while falling in love with a brilliant classmate who inspires him to not be defined by his cond","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8045906/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike","dateCreated":"2020-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Teenager learns to cope with his schizophrenia.","reviewBody":"Curious title, it refers to both real words written on school bathroom walls, and even more the imaginary words he sees when he had bouts with his mental illness.

Based on the cast I figured this would be another mainly generic teenage rom-com. But it is just the opposite. While Adam (Charlie Plummer) starts a relationship with the bright girl in class after he asks her to tutor him, the story is overwhelmingly about Adam, and his family, and ultimately his school coming to grips with his schizophrenia.

Plummer is required to really stretch his acting chops and he does it well. The middle third of the movie is hard to watch at times but fortunately the final third starts to bring some healing.

Good movie, my wife and I watched it at home on DVD from our public library.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7600,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-08-21","keywords":"based on young adult novel,schizophrenia,hallucination,hospital,restraint","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3428105753","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFiNDU4MzQtOGIzMS00ZGRmLWIzNTYtYmZjNmFhOGZlYzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager coping with paranoid schizophrenia hopes his new experimental drug treatment will help him navigate high school and the outside world.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4055138/","name":"Charlie Plummer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5347988/","name":"Taylor Russell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294457/","name":"Thor Freudenthal"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0811450/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192696/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4550950/","name":"Nick Naveda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9649443/","name":"Julia Walton"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent="

Adults in the Room
programme.desc:
Adults in the Room: Directed by Costa-Gavras. With Christos Loulis, Alexandros Bourdoumis, Ulrich Tukur, Daan Schuurmans. Greece in 2015: the economy is in tatters and the country is on the verge of bankruptcy. A new government rebels against the EU's iron-fisted rule and inspires millions of Europeans. Based on the political memoirs of Yanis Varoufakis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7493370/","name":"Adults in the Room","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ0MDg4Y2ItMjI2NS00NzQ5LWI5MDUtNTJkMmRkYmRkMzM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Greece in 2015: the economy is in tatters and the country is on the verge of bankruptcy. A new government rebels against the EU's iron-fisted rule and inspires millions of Europeans. Based on the political memoirs of Yanis Varoufakis","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7493370/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Green-Bubble"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Viewers obviously find it difficult to separate the movie, from the events representing.","reviewBody":"First of all, I will start by mentioning the obvious: The negative reviews are by not-so-bright Greeks who can't review a movie for what it is, but for what it shows. The summer of 2015 was a pretty heated period in Greece, and many people have not forgiven the politicians involved.

About the movie. Don't expect a masterpiece. It is not. However it is a decent representation of Varoufakis's point of view, which on each own, is extremely interesting. Loulis's performance as Varoufakis is the strongest asset of this movie in my opinion. Bourdoumis was very good as well as Tsipras.

Photography was good. Editing was good. I found the sound editing irritating, like I do in most Greek movies (why is that? Any greek production sounds weird to me, like they can't keep steady the volume of the voices spoken).

7/10 from me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5583,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-03","keywords":"greece,year 2015,debt,austerity,politics","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1348108/","name":"Christos Loulis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1135422/","name":"Alexandros Bourdoumis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0876300/","name":"Ulrich Tukur"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002020/","name":"Costa-Gavras"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090675/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024845/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237508/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5008243/","name":"Yanis Varoufakis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002020/","name":"Costa-Gavras"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Casino Royale
Casino Royale
programme.desc:
Casino Royale: Directed by Val Guest, Ken Hughes, John Huston, Joseph McGrath, Robert Parrish, Richard Talmadge. With Peter Sellers, Ursula Andress, David Niven, Orson Welles. In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0061452/","name":"Casino Royale","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlYzgyZTQtNDFiMy00ZGFjLTk2N2ItN2ViNzNhNzhhNGM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI2NDg0NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0061452/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BrandtSponseller"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"An experiment that didn't quite work","reviewBody":"Casino Royale has some outstanding elements. The production design is worth a 10. There are beautiful, often provocatively dressed or relatively undressed women everywhere you look. Many of its segments are funny; it's even occasionally hilarious.

The problem arose in putting all of it together. And with at least five directors and at least ten writers, it's not difficult to see why. The whole is a mess. There is little in the way of overarching plot. Most threads are just completely abandoned after awhile.

The story, which is very loosely based on Ian Fleming's James Bond novel Casino Royale (published in 1953--it's the first Bond novel), is a spoof of the typical adventure featuring the infamous secret agent. The real Bond (David Niven) went into retirement when his skills were at their peak. This Bond is quite different than the Bond we know--he is almost chaste, he's a homebody, he dedicates each evening's twilight to playing Debussy on the piano, and so on. Casino Royale has it that the Bond we know from other films is a decoy.

A group of older men, representing the secret agencies of the US, the UK, Russia and France, are on their way to the real Bond's home to ask for his assistance. It seems that someone has been trying to wipe out as many secret agents as they can. While they're pitching the idea of coming out of retirement to Bond, they're attacked. Bond's house is blown up, and he (implicitly) agrees to the assignment. Casino Royale is the story of the real Bond trying to get to the bottom of the sinister agent-wipeout plan. Part of carrying that out involves changing the identity of nearly every spy to James Bond--if the real Bond is to work unimpeded, he can't always be worrying about being killed by the criminal mastermind.

Each director worked on a different segment in relative isolation from the rest. This went so far as having their own portions of the script written. The problem was that despite Eon Productions (the production company behind most of the Bond films) not owning the rights to Casino Royale, they had used many of the "bits" in other Bond films. So there wasn't much of the book left to adapt. In addition, it was felt that a serious alternative Bond film couldn't compete against the Albert R. Broccoli/Harry Saltzman-produced films. So Casino Royale producers Jerry Bresler, John Dark and Charles K. Feldman had different writer/director teams create their own, parodic Bond segments that would be loosely tied together--it was almost a filmic version of the "Exquisite Corpse" game, in which you fold a piece of paper so that you can't see other persons' work, and you have to continue the drawing on your section with only a couple visual anchors.

Each segment features a different set of stars--the primary sets centering on Niven, Woody Allen, and Peter Sellers with Ursula Andress and Orson Welles. Those are all great actors, and great comedians in at least two cases. They all do a bit of their own schtick--in some cases, they demanded this. Woody does his neurotic New York Jew character, Peter Sellers rides the gray area between bumbling buffoon and suave playboy, with a couple generic Indian and Chinese impersonations thrown in for good measure, Orson Welles does his best Paul Masson Wine-pitching "elder statesman" demeanor, and also throws in a few of his more famous magic tricks. All of this stuff is good, but does it work as a unified film? No. And if that's not enough evidence for you, consider that the segments were further chopped up into set-pieces. There's the "M", or McTarry funeral stuff, the Niven car chase stuff, the Sellers/Andress romance stuff, and so on. Each set piece ends up being largely independent--you could almost see this as a series of skits on a similar theme. These facts make Casino Royale not quite work. It's certainly no match for a legitimate Bond film, despite the similarity of location-hopping, outrageous villains, spy gadgets and so on.

But, in isolation, the segments tend to be good to excellent. The stretch with Bond visiting the faux M widow is probably the funniest. It also presages the Sir Robin section of Monty Python and the Holy Grail (1975), but bests it in a way, if only because of its extension. The madcap ending of the film is a lot of fun for its embrace of absurdism as a supreme aesthetic disposition--and it may have even influenced some later films. And the segments with the trippiest visuals, both in the climax, are a fantastic treat for any fan of surrealism. They're good enough to watch the film just to see them. The production design is incredible throughout the film. Not just for the surrealism, but the lush Edwardian and Victorian interiors, complete with copies and works in similar styles to unique, influential artists such as Gustav Klimt and Otto Dix.

If we felt like being overly generous, we might be able to argue that the overarching mess of a plot was part of the point. This is a spoof of Bond, after all, and Bond novels and films tend to have sprawling plots--both geographically and narratively. We do travel to many exotic locales, meet many exotic people, doing exotic things, and we receive many plot intricacies and twists in both the typical Bond story and in Casino Royale. However, Bond films aren't quite convoluted or messy enough to deserve this kind of spoofing, so excusing the messiness of the whole to parodic intent seems an over-ambitious stretch.

Casino Royale is worth seeing, particularly if you're a big Bond fan or a big fan of any of the cast, or even if you just like a lot of late 1960s/early 1970s big, madcap comedies. Just don't expect anything like a tight story.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29154,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1967-04-23","keywords":"spy spoof,james bond spoof,parody,007,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi889568793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDEyNzZlYzUtYzljMy00Y2M4LWEzZDMtMDY4YjY0YjZkMTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDEyNzZlYzUtYzljMy00Y2M4LWEzZDMtMDY4YjY0YjZkMTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000057/","name":"David Niven"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000634/","name":"Peter Sellers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000266/","name":"Ursula Andress"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0346436/","name":"Val Guest"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001379/","name":"John Huston"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077420/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0542554/","name":"Wolf Mankowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492339/","name":"John Law"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0768476/","name":"Michael Sayers"}],"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

Feldman had different writer/director teams create their own, parodic Bond segments that would be loosely tied together--it was almost a filmic version of the "Exquisite Corpse" game, in which you fold a piece of paper so that you can't see other persons' work, and you have to continue the drawing on your section with only a couple visual anchors.

Each segment features a different set of stars--the primary sets centering on Niven, Woody Allen, and Peter Sellers with Ursula Andress and Orson Welles. Those are all great actors, and great comedians in at least two cases. They all do a bit of their own schtick--in some cases, they demanded this. Woody does his neurotic New York Jew character, Peter Sellers rides the gray area between bumbling buffoon and suave playboy, with a couple generic Indian and Chinese impersonations thrown in for good measure, Orson Welles does his best Paul Masson Wine-pitching "elder statesman" demeanor, and also throws in a few of his more famous magic tricks. This is a spoof of Bond, after all, and Bond novels and films tend to have sprawling plots--both geographically and narratively. We do travel to many exotic locales, meet many exotic people, doing exotic things, and we receive many plot intricacies and twists in both the typical Bond story and in Casino Royale. However, Bond films aren't quite convoluted or messy enough to deserve this kind of spoofing, so excusing the messiness of the whole to parodic intent seems an over-ambitious stretch.

Casino Royale is worth seeing, particularly if you're a big Bond fan or a big fan of any of the cast, or even if you just like a lot of late 1960s/early 1970s big, madcap comedies. Just don't expect anything like a tight story.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29154,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1,"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1967-04-23","keywords":"spy spoof,james bond spoof,parody,007,spy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi889568793","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDEyNzZlYzUtYzljMy00Y2M4LWEzZDMtMDY4YjY0YjZkMTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDEyNzZlYzUtYzljMy00Y2M4LWEzZDMtMDY4YjY0YjZkMTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000057/","name":"David Niven","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000634/","name":"Peter Sellers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000266/","name":"Ursula Andress"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0346436/","name":"Val Guest","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001379/","name":"John Huston"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077420/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0542554/","name":"Wolf Mankowitz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492339/","name":"John Law","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0768476/","name":"Michael Sayers"],"duration":"PT2H11M"</script><metacontent="

He accomplishes to find a balance between theatre and cinema. And, although the sets are claearly theatrical and the archive footage's relation to the action is at best obscure ( sometimes even opaque ), the story is very interesting and it is well acted ( I don't know if Brecht's distancing effect is used on purpose. If yes, then it is superbly acted. ). programme.title: American Gangster
American Gangster
programme.desc:
American Gangster: Directed by Ridley Scott. With Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Josh Brolin. An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0765429/","name":"American Gangster","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFmZGI2YTEtYmJhMS00YTE5LWJjNjAtNDI5OGY5ZDhmNTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAwMTU1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0765429/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andrewfreeley87"},"dateCreated":"2007-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Detractors of this film were fooled by the trailer.","reviewBody":"American Gangster has been really hated upon in many of the former posts I have read. Yet it seems like they are all saying the same thing, that Gangster didn't have enough action and was really drawn out. Anyone who has every seen a Ridley Scott film will know that his films are long! Blade Runner, A Good Year, Matchstick Men, Hannibal, Black Hawk Down, Gladiator, G.I. Jane, Thelma and Louis, and Alien all ran for at least two hours or more, so big surprise there guys. In addition Scott didn't set out to film another scarface, he set out to tell a story not just about Frank Lucas but rather a tale of corruption and how pervasive it is. One user commented that this film had many side story lines that "bloated" the story. This is completely untrue as every "side story" is actually the overarching story about the fight against corruption in every facet of life, even Frank Lucas attempts several times to eradicate the corruption in his organization.

Over all this is a great film which really gets into every nook and cranny of an issue. Don't see this film if your just looking for cheap thrills, this is a thinking film about the pervasive dishonesty of our culture.

I gave this film 8 stars because i could find nothing solid that detracted from it, but rather a slew of minor details which gradually brought its score down.
